title: Coca-Cola in talks about cut-price £2bn sale of Costa Coffee
summary: American owner said to be working with bankers on review of chain, which has more than 2,000 UK outlets Costa Coffee could change hands again after it emerged that Coca-Cola has met potential buyers to discuss a cut-price deal to off-load the chain. The American soft drinks company is said to be working with bankers on a review of Costa, Britain’s biggest coffee chain, that could lead to it being sold. Continue reading...
